Package com.github.ds67.jminicache

Interface MiniCache<Key,​Value>

  • Type Parameters:
    Key - Type of the access key of the cached items. A key should not be muted after usage in the cache. It must provide a working Object.equals(Object) and Object.hashCode() implementation.
    Value - Type of the cached item
    All Superinterfaces:
    Flow.Publisher<CacheChangeEvent<Key,​Value>>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    MiniCacheImpl
    public interface MiniCache<Key,​Value>
extends Flow.Publisher<CacheChangeEvent<Key,​Value>>
    Provided cache interface. For usage simple create an builder and set the desired configuration. Example: final var cache = new MiniCacheBuilder<Integer, Integer>() .setEvictionPolicy(MiniCacheBuilder.EvictionPolicy.EVICTION_FIFO) .setMaxSize(maxSize) .build(); Item access
    • fetch(Object)
    • get(Object, ValueSupplier)
    • get(Object, ValueSupplier, long)
    item manipulation
    • set(Object, Object)
    • set(Object, ValueWithExpiry)
    • remove(Object)
    • clear()
    Information:
    • isEmpty()
    • size()
    • contains(Object)
    • entrySetWithExpiryDate()
    • entrySet()
    • values()
    • keySet()
    Mass settings of cached items:
    • set(Set, long)
    • set(Map, long)
    • set(Map)
    Configuration:
    • setMaxSize(int)
    • setRefreshMethod(Function)
    • setValueFactory(Function)
    • setValueWithExpiryFactory(Function)
    Configuration information:
    • getMaxSize()
    • getValueWithExpiryFactory()
    Author:
    Jens Ketterer
    See Also:
    MiniCacheBuilder

    • Method Detail

      • get

        <E extends Throwable> Value get​(Key key,
                                ValueSupplier<ValueWithExpiry<Value>,​E> supplier)
                         throws E extends Throwable
        Retrieves a cache value, if the key does not exists in the cache the provided supplier function is called to populate the cache (with expiry date). get(Object, ValueSupplier) calls with other keys will not be suspended will the value will be fetched. When the supplier methods throws an exception this exception will be re thrown by the method. No insertion in the cache will take place. This is the preferred method for interacting with the cache when no manual controlling of the cache content is necessary. You hust need a single method which will be used for reading cache content and fill in the cache data when necessary. 
        
   static int fac (int n)
   {
   	int result = 1;
      for (int i=0;i<;n;i++) result*=n;
      return result;
   }
   
   static void main (String argv[])
   {
       var cache = new MiniCache<Integer,Integer>();
       
       for (int i=0;i<;1000;i++) {
          System.out.println (cache.get (i%20, () -> fac(i%20)));
       };
   }
        Type Parameters:
        E - Exception type the supplier function returns. Works also fine when the supplier does not return an exception.
        Parameters:
        key - key by which the desired value can be found. The key can be any object which provides a well defined Object.hashCode() and Object.equals(Object) method.
        supplier - Function which will be called when the key is not found in the cache. The implementation will guarantee that the supplier method will be called only once for a certain key regardless how many parallel requests are made and how long the value retrieval takes. Waiting get(Object, ValueSupplier) for the same key will return the provides value upon availability.
        Returns:
        Value which was retrieved from the cache. As a supplier is provided it is guranteed that a value is returned. However, when the supplier provides a null this is cached and returned.
        Throws:
        E - Exception the supplier function throws. It is simply rethrown after cleanup of the get function.
        E extends Throwable
        See Also:
        fetch(Object)

      • get

        <E extends Throwable> Value get​(Key key,
                                ValueSupplier<Value,​E> supplier,
                                long expireDate)
                         throws E extends Throwable
        Retrieves a cache value, if the key does not exists in the cache the provided supplier function is called to populate the cache (without expiry date). Simple version of get(Object, ValueSupplier)
        Type Parameters:
        E - Exception which is thrown by the Suppier Method. Unfortenately only one exception type can be returned in a generic signature.
        Parameters:
        key - key by which the desired value can be found. The key can be any object which provides a well defined Object.hashCode() and Object.equals(Object) method.
        supplier - Function which will be called when the key is not found in the cache. The implementation will guarantee that the supplier method will be called only once for a certain key regardless how many parallel requests are made and how long the value retrieval takes. Waiting get(Object, ValueSupplier) for the same key will return the provides value upon availability.
        expireDate - timestamp in milliseconds when the entry will expire
        Returns:
        retrieved value from cache or newly generated value when not existed
        Throws:
        E - Exception the supplier function throws. It is simply rethrown after cleanup of the get function.
        E extends Throwable

      • set

        void set​(Key key,
         Value value)
        Adds a value to the cache without setting a expiry date No expiry date will be set, the lifetime will just be limited by the configured eviction policiy
        Parameters:
        key - lookup key of the value
        value - value to add

        void set​(Key key,
         Value value,
         long expiryDate)
        Adds a value to the cache with a expiry date
        Parameters:
        key - lookup key of the value
        value - value to add
        expiryDate - timestamp in milliseconds when the value will expire

      • set

        void set​(Map<Key,​Value> content,
         long expiryDate)
        Add a list of entries to the cache at once. In comparison to the one element set(Object, Object) function this function will lock the cache for writing just once to insert all elements and is thus faster. However, when other requests start piling up the insertation is interrupted and other requests will be executed before continuing to insert. Existing keys in the cache will be overwritten. Other content in the cache will stay untouched.
        Parameters:
        content - Map of key and value elements to be inserted in the map. The map itself must not be altered will inserting into the cache.
        expiryDate - timestamp (in milliseconds like System.getCurrentMillis()) when the entries will expire and be removed from the cache The map elements are not deep copied into the cache

      • set

        void set​(Set<Map.Entry<Key,​Value>> entries)

      • set

        void set​(Set<Map.Entry<Key,​Value>> entries,
         long expiryDate)

      • set

        void set​(Map<Key,​ValueWithExpiry<Value>> content)

      • get

        Value get​(Key key)
        Retrieves an existing value from the cache. If the key is not in the cache the value factory will be used to generate the value. If no value factory is set the method behaves like the fetch(Object) method.
        Parameters:
        key - key for which the value should be retrieved
        Returns:
        The retrieved value or null when the key does not exists in the cache.
        See Also:
        setValueFactory(Function), setValueWithExpiryFactory(Function)

      • fetch

        Value fetch​(Key key)
        Fetches a value from the cache without creating values, even when a valueFactory method is set Will return a null value when the requested key is not cached. Use this method in favor to the get methods when the cache fill is done in batch inserts.
        Parameters:
        key - key for which the value should be retrieved
        Returns:
        Value item which is stored for the key or null when nothing is stored.
        See Also:
        get(Object)

        void remove​(Key key)
        Removed an object from the cache
        Parameters:
        key - which will be removed from the cache

        Returns:

        Checks if a key is contained in the cache
        Parameters:
        key - key to check for containment
        Returns:
        true when the key exists in the cache, false otherwise

      • setMaxSize

        MiniCache<Key,​Value> setMaxSize​(int maxSize)
        Sets the maximum cache entry size. When the size is less than 1 it is considered as unbounded, regardless of the eviction policy. When the eviction policy is MiniCacheBuilder.EvictionPolicy.EVICTION_NONE setting the maximum size has no effect
        Parameters:
        maxSize - new maximum cache entry size.
        Returns:
        this object to provide a builder like interface

      • getMaxSize

        int getMaxSize()

      • setValueWithExpiryFactory

        MiniCache<Key,​Value> setValueWithExpiryFactory​(Function<Key,​ValueWithExpiry<Value>> valueFactory)
        Sets a value factory function for the cache. The value factory generates from a given key the corresponding value. It is called when the requested key is not found in the cache. The generated value is then stored in the cache and returned from the function. Set the value factory to null to delete an currently installed factory. Be aware that the value factory function must be reentrant. That means that it might be called for different key in parallel. However it will not be called for the same key in parallel.
        Parameters:
        valueFactory - supplier function which takes a key object and produced the cachable item of type Value
        Returns:
        this object to provide a builder like interface
        See Also:
        get(Object), getValueWithExpiryFactory()

      • setValueFactory

        MiniCache<Key,​Value> setValueFactory​(Function<Key,​Value> valueFactory)

      • setRefreshMethod

        MiniCache<Key,​Value> setRefreshMethod​(Function<Key,​ValueWithExpiry<Value>> refreshMethod)
        Installes a method which will be called when cache entries are expired. This method is called with the expired key as argument and mus return a ValueWithExpiry object. The new object might also be unlimited valid. Please note that the refresh method is executed in the context of the scheduler threads. If you have many items waiting for refreshment you should consider installing an own multithreaded scheduler to handle all requests near real time. The existing item is replaced when a new value is available. Therefore, when refreshing is slow, the old value will be visible further than the expire date.
        Parameters:
        refreshMethod - method to refresh a key or null to stop refreshing a remove keys again.
        Returns:
        the current object to allow method chaining
        See Also:
        MiniCacheBuilder.setSchedulerService(java.util.concurrent.ScheduledExecutorService), MiniCacheBuilder.getSchedulerService()

      • getValueWithExpiryFactory

        Function<Key,​ValueWithExpiry<Value>> getValueWithExpiryFactory()
        Gets the currently installed valueFactory. When you installed a value factory without an ValueWithExpiry return value an automatic wrapping of you function was done and you need to unwrap it: Function<Key,Value> yourFunction = ValueWithExpiry.unwrap(cache.getValueWithExpiryFactory());
        Returns:
        the installed value factory or null if non is installed
        See Also:
        setValueFactory(Function), setValueWithExpiryFactory(Function), ValueWithExpiry.unwrap(Function)

      • entrySet

        Set<Map.Entry<Key,​Value>> entrySet()
        Retrieves the key/value pair of all stored entries in the cache.
        Returns:
        entrySet of the cache

      • entrySetWithExpiryDate

        Set<Map.Entry<Key,​ValueWithExpiry<Value>>> entrySetWithExpiryDate()
        Retrieves the key/value pair of all stored entries in the cache. The values are extended with the current known expiry times. If no expiry manager is installed all expiry times are set to 0. Please note that this methods needs O(n*log(n)) processing time with n cached elements when a expire manager is in place in contrast to the @see #entrySet() method.
        Returns:
        entrySet of the cache when the values are extended with the known expire dates
        See Also:
        ValueWithExpiry

      • subscribe

        void subscribe​(Flow.Subscriber<? super CacheChangeEvent<Key,​Value>> subscriber)
        Offers an subscription interface to monitor changes to the cache. New inserts, updates and removals are published asynchronously using the #java.util.concurrent.Flow mechanisms. You may add as many subscribers as you like.
        Specified by:
        subscribe in interface Flow.Publisher<Key>
